item.title: Richard add a quote by Upton Sinclair
item.description: "Fascism is capitalism plus murder." -- Upton Sinclair

item.title: Richard add a quote by Upton Sinclair
item.description: "It is difficult to get a man to understand something, when his salary depends on his not understanding it." -- Upton Sinclair

item.title: Richard add a quote by Upton Sinclair
item.description: "They use everything about the hog except the squeal." -- Upton Sinclair

item.title: Richard add a quote by Upton Sinclair
item.description: "A large section of the idling classes of England get their incomes by believing that Jesus was born of a virgin and that Jonah swallowed a whale; and with the progress of science they were naturally finding this more and more difficult. A school of ingenious Bible-twisters arose, to invent symbolical and literary meanings for fairy tales, in order that people who no longer believed could continue with good conscience to collect the salaries of belief." -- Upton Sinclair

item.title: Richard add a quote by Upton Sinclair
item.description: "Wall Street had been doing business with pieces of paper; and now someone asked for a dollar, and it was discovered that the dollar had been mislaid." -- Upton Sinclair

item.title: Richard add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "If there is to be any peace it will come through being, not having." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Richard add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "The moment one gives close attention to anything, even a blade of grass, it becomes a mysterious, awesome, indescribably magnificent world in itself" -- Henry Miller
